content.title: Mathematical Concept or Theorem Name
content.definition: Precise mathematical definition using standard notation (50-200 words).
key_points: Most important property or aspect of the concept
Third key insight about behavior or applications
Fourth point about special cases or limitations
Sixth point about relationship to other concepts
Seventh point about computational aspects or algorithms

examples.title: Basic Example
examples.description: Simple concrete example with complete solution
examples.context: Why this example illustrates the concept well

examples.title: Advanced Example
examples.description: More complex application or proof technique
examples.context: What makes this example challenging or interesting

examples.title: Counterexample
examples.description: Example showing where concept doesn't apply or common mistake
examples.context: What this teaches about boundaries of the concept

examples.title: Applied Example
examples.description: Real-world application in science, engineering, or other field
examples.context: Practical significance of the mathematical concept

content.statement: Precise mathematical statement of theorem, definition, or principle

explanation.intuition: Intuitive understanding without heavy formalism (100-200 words). Use analogies, geometric interpretations, or concrete examples.
explanation.key_insight: The core mathematical insight that makes the concept 'click' (100-200 words). Explain the fundamental idea or mechanism.
explanation.technical_details: Rigorous mathematical exposition (300-500 words). Include precise conditions, assumptions, and domain of validity.

theorem_statement.conclusion: Precise statement of what is proven

explanation.proof_sketch: High-level overview of proof technique or main ideas (if applicable)

mathematical_formulation.notation: Explanation of all symbols and notation used

explanation.computational_aspects: How to compute or evaluate, algorithms if applicable, complexity
explanation.historical_context: Who developed the concept, when, and why it was important
explanation.connections: Relationships to other areas of mathematics
explanation.applications: Where this concept is used in mathematics or other fields

sources.source: Author, A. (2021). Mathematical Analysis, Edition. Publisher.
Original Author. (YEAR). Original Paper Title. Journal, Volume(Issue), pages.
sources.relevance: Original development of theorem or concept

sources.source: Advanced Author. (YEAR). Advanced Topics in [Area]. Publisher.
Applied Author. (YEAR). Applications of [Concept]. Journal, Volume, pages.
Historical Author. (YEAR). History of Mathematical Concepts. Publisher.
Computational Author. (YEAR). Numerical Methods for [Area]. Publisher.

provenance.verification_notes: Mathematical statements verified against authoritative sources. Proofs checked. Examples validated.
